content.description: Start lower by crimping onto the vertical cracks and leaning. Use the cracks, right sloper side-pull, and some fingery crimps to climb up this side of the boulder.  After the obvious right-hand slopey hold, the route slants to the left.  The trick of the route is to not touch the annoyingly in-the-way tree while doing it, even though your body will want to lean into it.  This is very much more of a finesse route rather than a power/strength route.
content.location: Back Left of the boulder (looking from the road).  It is where there is a tree right next to the rock.

content.description: ~10ft boulder just off the road with a couple potential problems on it, mostly difficult, waiting to be established. The easiest one is on the back left beside the tree.
